location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Coll 30/231 'Annual Political Review of Events in the Persian Gulf'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file. There is a set of file notes on folio 15.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 16; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains copies of the Annual Report (political review of events in the Persian Gulf) of the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Lieutenant-Colonel Sir William Rupert Hay, for the years 1948 and 1949. The report for 1948 was the first to be submitted to the Foreign Office. The reports provide a summary of political events in the ten Arab shaikhdoms on the western shore of the Persian Gulf, whose foreign relations were handled by the British Government, and Muscat and Oman.
